status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577
 
 
   This is another attempt to present the information without overwhelming in the case where there is a large binary metadata blog. So the default will show just metadata keys like so:
   
   ```
   foo: int32 not null, metadata.keys: ['key1']
   bar: string, metadata.keys: ['key3']
   -- schema.metadata.keys: ['key2']
   ```
   
   Another option is to show values truncated to 50 chars (or 80 chars less the length of the key and other whitespace chars)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

bkietz commented on pull request #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#discussion_r392577864
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_schema.py
 ##########
 @@ -245,13 +245,23 @@ def test_schema():
 def test_schema_to_string_with_metadata():
     # ARROW-7063
     my_schema = pa.schema([pa.field("foo", "int32", False,
-                                    metadata={"key1": "value1"})],
+                                    metadata={"key1": "value1"}),
+                           pa.field("bar", "string", True,
+                                    metadata={"key3": "value3"})],
                           metadata={"key2": "value2"})
 
-    assert my_schema.to_string(show_metadata=True) == """\
+    assert my_schema.to_string() == """\
+foo: int32 not null, metadata.keys: ['key1']
+bar: string, metadata.keys: ['key3']
+-- schema.metadata.keys: ['key2']"""
+
+    assert my_schema.to_string(verbose_metadata=True) == """\
 foo: int32 not null
   -- metadata --
   key1: value1
+foo: string
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
   bar: string
   ```

wesm commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-606938318
 
 
   Thanks @bkietz for picking this up! 
   
   There's a small edge case when there are 0 additional characters:
   
   ```
   In [10]: pa.schema([('f0', 'int32')], metadata={'key': 'value' + 'x' * 65})                                                   
   Out[10]: 
   f0: int32
   -- metadata --
   key: 'valuexxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx' + 0
   ```
   
   I'll fix that and rebase. Any other feedback on this, @kou or @jorisvandenbossche want to look again?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-606961889
 
 
   I worked on this a little bit to make the Field metadata display consistently also, take a look
   
   ```
   In [1]: sch = pa.schema([pa.field('f0', 'int32', metadata={'k1': 'v1'*100})],  
                           metadata={'key': 'value' + 'x' * 1000})         
   
   In [2]: sch                                                                                                                   
   Out[2]: 
   f0: int32
     -- field metadata --
     k1: 'v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1v1' + 132
   -- schema metadata --
   key: 'valuexxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx' + 935
   ```
   
   This patch is good by me, I'll wait until tomorrow sometime before merging since this isn't the first patch altering the metadata display so avoiding churn would be good
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-607391465
 
 
   One reason to maybe not show the field metadata in the table / schema repr *by default*, is that nowadays any table that was read from parquet will include field metadata ..
   
   ```
   In [5]: table = pa.table(pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10,5), columns=list('abcde')))
   
   In [6]: pq.write_table(table, 'test.parquet') 
   
   In [7]: pq.read_table('test.parquet')  
   Out[7]: 
   pyarrow.Table
   a: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '1'
   b: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '2'
   c: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '3'
   d: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '4'
   e: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '5'
   -- schema metadata --
   pandas: '{"index_columns": [{"kind": "range", "name": null, "start": 0, "stop":' + 808
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-607391465
 
 
   One reason to maybe not show the field metadata in the table / schema repr *by default*, is that nowadays any table that was read from parquet will include field metadata, which can get quite verbose then  ..
   
   ```
   In [5]: table = pa.table(pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10,5), columns=list('abcde')))
   
   In [6]: pq.write_table(table, 'test.parquet') 
   
   In [7]: pq.read_table('test.parquet')  
   Out[7]: 
   pyarrow.Table
   a: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '1'
   b: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '2'
   c: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '3'
   d: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '4'
   e: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '5'
   -- schema metadata --
   pandas: '{"index_columns": [{"kind": "range", "name": null, "start": 0, "stop":' + 808
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-607427756
 
 
   Another observation, but somewhat unrelated because I assume it takes different code paths, the Field repr in Python actually is less informative, as it doesn't show the metadata (with the example from above):
   
   ```
   In [9]: pq.read_table('test.parquet').schema.field('a') 
   Out[9]: pyarrow.Field<a: double>
   ```
   
   (and if there is one place where I would certainly show it by default, it is here)
   
   Regarding my comment above, it might all get complicated, if we want to have fine control over whether to show no, truncated, or full metadata, potentially separately for fields as for schema metadata. So take my comment with a grain of salt. 
   But it could be an option to eg for the table repr show less by default, and for the schema repr more.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

wesm commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-607433402
 
 
   Okay, I'll make another iteration to add a third mode of hiding schema or field metadata and thread that through the Python reprs. I think the Schema repr should show the medium verbosity output (both schema and field metadata showing, with truncation) by default, but the Table repr can be more condensed (neither field nor schema metadata showing)

wesm commented on issue #6577: ARROW-7904: [C++][Python] Revamp metadata display, change show_metadata to verbose_metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6577#issuecomment-607509560
 
 
   Alright, I added options to suppress Schema and Field metadata when pretty-printing a Schema, and exposed this in Python. 
   
   Now we have
   
   ```
   In [2]: In [5]: table = pa.table(pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(10,5), columns=list('abcde'))) 
      ...:  
      ...: In [6]: pq.write_table(table, 'test.parquet')  
      ...:  
      ...: table = pq.read_table('test.parquet')                                                                                 
   
   In [3]: table                                                                                                                 
   Out[3]: 
   pyarrow.Table
   a: double
   b: double
   c: double
   d: double
   e: double
   
   In [5]: print(table.to_string(show_metadata=True))                                                                            
   pyarrow.Table
   a: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '1'
   b: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '2'
   c: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '3'
   d: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '4'
   e: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '5'
   -- schema metadata --
   pandas: '{"index_columns": [{"kind": "range", "name": null, "start": 0, "' + 804
   
   In [6]: table.schema                                                                                                          
   Out[6]: 
   a: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '1'
   b: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '2'
   c: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '3'
   d: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '4'
   e: double
     -- field metadata --
     PARQUET:field_id: '5'
   -- schema metadata --
   pandas: '{"index_columns": [{"kind": "range", "name": null, "start": 0, "' + 804
   ```
   
   I'm going to go ahead and merge this once the builds are green and further refinements / tweaks are welcome in follow up patches
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
